definition: Charles De Gaulle (1890-1970), French general and politician, leader of the Free French during World War II and president of the Republic 1959-1969
to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc)/to respect/to bear/to support

sentences.english: De Gaulle was, at that time, considered a disloyal soldier.
sentences.chinese: 當時戴高樂被看作是一個不忠實的軍人。

sentences.english: She had spent the night at Charles de Gaulle airport.
sentences.chinese: 她被迫在戴高樂機場過夜。

sentences.english: De Gaule stood between France and chaos.
sentences.chinese: 戴高樂阻止了法國的混亂局面。

sentences.english: I myself have become a Gaullist only little by little.
sentences.chinese: 我本身也只是一點一點地才成爲一個戴高樂主義者的。

sentences.english: Others in the ruling party accused Sarkozy of betraying his Gaullist heritage.
sentences.chinese: 執政黨中還有其他人也指責薩科奇背叛了戴高樂主義。

sentences.english: Paris CDG has 56 departures per week to Brazil.
sentences.chinese: 巴黎戴高樂有56至巴西班次每週。

sentences.english: The policy adopted by U. S. to cope the Gaullism is basically successful.
sentences.chinese: 美國對戴高樂主義的應對政策，基本取得了成功。

sentences.english: He's paying tribute to the Free French Forces under De-Gaulle and Leclerc.
sentences.chinese: 他在向戴高樂與雷克勒克麾下的自由法國軍隊致敬。

sentences.english: Rio DE janeiro, Brazil take-off aircraft from Charles DE gaulle international airport flight to Paris.
sentences.chinese: 飛機從巴西里約熱內盧起飛飛往巴黎戴高樂國際機場。

sentences.english: People hurrahed to de Gaulle for 20 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 人們向戴高樂高呼萬歲達20多分鐘。
